head.title: Police Search Home Of Brooklyn Man And Find Old Skulls

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Police Search Home Of Brooklyn Man And Find Old Skulls

block.p: Three human skulls and a small cache of chemicals and gunpowder were discovered in a cluttered Brooklyn apartment early yesterday, initially stirring fears that the police had stumbled upon the gruesome lair of a serial killer.
But the authorities later determined that the skulls were 70 to 80 years old, the gunpowder was left over from the Fourth of July and the chemicals were simple fertilizer.

Three human skulls and a small cache of chemicals and gunpowder were discovered in a cluttered Brooklyn apartment early yesterday, initially stirring fears that the police had stumbled upon the gruesome lair of a serial killer.
But the authorities later determined that the skulls were 70 to 80 years old, the gunpowder was left over from the Fourth of July and the chemicals were simple fertilizer.
''We are not treating these as homicides; this is not some sort of Jeffrey Dahmer,'' a police official said.

The skulls and chemicals were found inside a single-room apartment in Bushwick after the man who lived there was arrested on charges that he stood in the street and fired a .22-caliber pistol into the air after arguing with another man about 6 p.m. Thursday, the police said.
Police officers approached the man, who ran into his apartment at 20 Wilson Avenue, the police said. The officers arrested Claudio Toral, 23, inside, where a skull was in plain view, the police said.
The police obtained a search warrant and found two other skulls in the early hours yesterday. One was in a small gray suitcase, and the other two were in a cardboard box, the police said.

A friend and neighbor of Mr. Toral said that the young man had the skulls because he was a fan of heavy metal music. ''Just because he bought a couple of skulls, that doesn't make him a nut,'' said the friend, Nestor DeJesus.
Mr. Toral was charged with weapons possession and menacing in the firing of the pistol, the police said.
